newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan cuts Internet domain using "Yahoo" address.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan cuts Internet domain using "Yahoo" address.

text.p: The Taiwan agency responsible for monitoring the Internet said on Monday it has cut off a domestic website that carried an address resembling that of the worldwide search vehicle provided by U.S.-based Yahoo! Inc.

The Institute for Information Industry said an Internet guide provided by a Taiwan company called "Szu Tung" had been using the domain name, or address, http://www.yahoo.com.tw. Yahoo!'s domain name is http://www.yahoo.com.

"While copyright laws recording Internet materials are still unclear, our policy is to reject any domain name that comes too close to a famous international site," an official for the institute said by telephone.
Yahoo is one of the world's most widely used Internet search engines.
She said the institute decided to terminate the address after it received a complaint from Yahoo!.
